page.title: 12SOUTHEND NEWS JUN/JUL 2
page.content: {SOCSocial Concerns}:Fears as DHSS cuts rent for long stay resort residents from max Â£49 to Â£25.Crime waves and homeless youngsters fear.Church halls ready to shelter if needed.Drug and glue related incidents common e.g. Richard Stevens (17) hung himself from a goalpost after sniffing. {Plans}:Two stadiums,Football and Grey- hound both facing financial losses propose plans to redevelop their inner city sites.Greyhound racing to end but Football to move to airport site.Council not keen on this idea! {Historical}:Archaeologist Mrs Arscott complains that Saxon hut and Iron Age circles bulldozed prematurely at Temple Sutton Industrial Estate. {Events}:Raft Race attracts 110 wacky vessels,won by Fisical Flyers. M.P. Teddy Taylor buried in sand as a stunt in the 6 O'clock show on ITV.
